decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering opponents' spells, removing threats, and gaining card advantage through card draw. The win condition revolves around casting Approach of the Second Sun to either gain life and win the game, or by drawing it again to win on the second cast. The deck also includes board wipes and spot removal to maintain control of the board, while utilizing Search for Azcanta to filter cards and find key pieces. A single Torrential Gearhulk provides additional value by casting spells from the graveyard.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost burn spells and powerful creatures with haste. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent by quickly removing threats and attacking with creatures like Glorybringer and Hazoret the Fervent. Chandra, Torch of Defiance provides card advantage and additional burn damage, while cards like Bomat Courier and Soul-Scar Mage help in maintaining card advantage and dealing incremental damage. The deck also includes utility lands like Scavenger Grounds and Treasure Map to enhance its overall strategy.

The deck focuses on playing efficient creatures and removal spells to control the board early on, while also generating energy to power up cards like Whirler Virtuoso and Aether Hub. The deck has a mix of aggressive threats like Hostage Taker and The Scarab God, as well as card advantage engines like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner and Rogue Refiner. The mana base is designed to support the three-color combination of red, green, and blue, allowing for a flexible and powerful gameplay experience. Overall, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Glorybringer and Toolcraft Exemplar, supplemented by powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Unlicensed Disintegration to control the board. The inclusion of vehicles like Heart of Kiran and Aethersphere Harvester helps maintain pressure on the opponent while also providing additional value. Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Hazoret the Fervent serve as additional sources of damage and card advantage. The mana base is designed to support a fast and consistent curve, allowing the deck to overwhelm opponents quickly with a combination of creatures and removal.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and versatile removal spells, focusing on efficiency and aggression. By utilizing the energy mechanic and a mix of threats like Glorybringer, The Scarab God, and Nicol Bolas, God-Pharaoh, the deck puts pressure on the opponent while also being able to adapt to different board states. The inclusion of cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Whirler Virtuoso provides card advantage and board presence, allowing the deck to maintain a high tempo and close out games quickly.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and dealing damage to the opponent as fast as possible. It utilizes energy-generating cards like Servant of the Conduit and Whirler Virtuoso alongside powerful creatures with abilities like Bristling Hydra and Glorybringer to control the battlefield. The deck also includes removal spells like Harnessed Lightning and Abrade to clear the way for continued aggression. Chandra, Torch of Defiance provides additional card advantage and damage potential while The Scarab God can generate value from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells.

The main concept of this Aggro Red Deck Wins deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using low-cost spells and creatures. The deck includes powerful burn spells like Lightning Strike and Shock, along with aggressive creatures like Hazoret the Fervent and Rampaging Ferocidon. The deck also includes cards like Harsh Mentor and Bomat Courier to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain a fast pace. Overall, the focus is on dealing a large amount of damage early in the game and overwhelming the opponent before they can stabilize.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the energy mechanic in order to ramp up quickly and play aggressive creatures such as Longtusk Cub and Bristling Hydra. By generating energy through cards like Attune with Aether and Servant of the Conduit, the deck can power out threats early and maintain board presence. The removal spells like Abrade and Harnessed Lightning help control the board while cards like Whirler Virtuoso and Chandra, Torch of Defiance provide additional value and threats. The deck aims to be proactive and pressuring, overwhelming the opponent with efficient threats and removal.

The main concept of the deck is to aggressively play creatures like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner, Rogue Refiner, and Servant of the Conduit to generate card advantage and ramp into powerful threats like The Scarab God and Vraska, Relic Seeker. It also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Harnessed Lightning to deal with opponent's threats. The mana base supports a mix of colors for the Temur color combination and includes support lands like Aether Hub and Botanical Sanctum. The deck aims to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent early on to secure a win.

The deck focuses on efficiently dropping creatures to apply pressure on the opponent, with a mix of aggression and control elements. By utilizing energy cards like Servant of the Conduit and Longtusk Cub, as well as powerful creatures like Glorybringer and The Scarab God, the deck aims to quickly establish board presence and maintain tempo. Removal spells like Magma Spray and Harnessed Lightning help deal with opposing threats, while powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Vraska, Relic Seeker provide additional threats and utility. The mana base is designed to support the diverse color requirements of the deck.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through creature removal and powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance. It also utilizes cards like The Scarab God and Hostage Taker for additional value by stealing opponents' creatures. The deck has a mix of efficient removal spells like Abrade and Vraska's Contempt, alongside energy generators like Harnessed Lightning and Whirler Virtuoso. The creatures in the deck provide card advantage and board presence, with a finishing touch from powerful threats like Glorybringer. The mana base is tuned for consistency, ensuring the deck can cast its spells effectively.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with fast and aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to deal damage quickly and efficiently. This Red Deck Wins archetype focuses on playing low-cost, high-power creatures like Earthshaker Khenra and Hazoret the Fervent, along with a variety of burn spells like Lightning Strike and Shock to clear the way for attacks. The inclusion of cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Rampaging Ferocidon helps provide additional damage and disruption to control the game and secure a victory.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By playing low-cost, efficient creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Earthshaker Khenra, alongside powerful burn spells like Shock and Lightning Strike, this deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Hazoret the Fervent and Rampaging Ferocidon provide additional late-game threats to ensure victory. Using a combination of creature damage and burn spells, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain a fast and aggressive pace by utilizing the energy mechanic and efficient creatures. The deck aims to generate and utilize energy through cards like Harnessed Lightning, Attune with Aether, and Servant of the Conduit to power up cards like Longtusk Cub and Whirler Virtuoso. It also utilizes strong creatures like Bristling Hydra and Glorybringer to quickly dominate the board and put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Abrade and Magma Spray to control the opponent's board and keep the aggression going.

This deck focuses on quickly building up energy with cards like Attune with Aether and Aether Hub to power up strong aggressive creatures like Whirler Virtuoso and Longtusk Cub. The deck also includes removal spells like Magma Spray and Abrade to deal with opposing threats, while also having counterspells like Essence Scatter for additional protection. The deck's top end includes powerful finishers like Glorybringer and Chandra, Torch of Defiance to close out games quickly. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board presence to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on filling the graveyard with creatures using Minister of Inquiries and Champion of Wits, as well as utilizing Chart a Course and Strategic Planning for card advantage. The goal is to bring back powerful creatures with Refurbish and God-Pharaoh's Gift, overwhelming the opponent with a constant stream of threats like Angel of Invention. The deck also includes control elements like Fumigate and Cast Out to handle opponent's threats, while Search for Azcanta helps with card filtering and land drops. The main win condition is to outvalue the opponent with the recursion of powerful creatures.
